treatment.description: Plants annual or short-lived per-ennial; caudex (stem base) (1–)1.5–3.5(–4.2) mm. Stems without purple epidermal inclu-sions. Leaf blades 0.5–1.5 mm wide. Flower clusters 3–20 mm wide.
treatment.discussion: The diminutive var. chartacea is threatened by habitat destruction via both housing developments and citrus grove expansion in central Florida. R. Kral (1983) suggested that it is an early successional species in sand scrub areas since it thrives on bare sands but disappears as taller herbs become established.
